posts.title: The Rope Maker of Boston and Samuel Adams
posts.text: In 1797, Isaac Davis, a rope maker of Boston officially had his name changed. To help him stand out from the crowd of other Isaac Davises,  he added a ‘P’ to his name as a middle initial: Isaac P. Davis.

posts.title: Captain Cook's Mouldy Bread
posts.text: A prosaic letter from Captain James Cook gives us a glimpse into preparations for his epic second voyage.
